keyword: calories in a cup of uncooked rice
title: Calories in a Cup of Uncooked Rice
meta_description: Discover calories in a cup of uncooked rice, plus carbs, protein, fat, per-100g basis, and preparation tweaks for better nutrition tracking.
h1: Calories in a Cup of Uncooked Rice
assumptions: Long-grain white rice, uncooked; 1 cup ≈ 185 g dry weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, brand, grain length, and measurement; cooked rice yields more volume but similar calories. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of uncooked white rice provides ~675 kcal and ~148 g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp vegetable oil per cup

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of uncooked rice?
faqs.a: About 675 kcal for one cup of uncooked long-grain white rice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cup of uncooked rice?
faqs.a: Approximately 148 g carbs, with 2.4 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is uncooked rice higher in calories than cooked?
faqs.a: Calories are similar per dry weight, but cooked rice expands (1 cup uncooked ≈ 3 cups cooked).

faqs.q: How much protein in a cup of uncooked rice?
Does rice type affect calories per cup?
faqs.a: Yes—brown rice is slightly lower (~655 kcal), jasmine or basmati vary by 10-20 kcal.
